titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 5931, PROHIBITING FUTURE RANSOM PAYMENTS TO IRAN ACT

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 5931, PROHIBITING FUTURE RANSOM PAYMENTS TO IRAN ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 144

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Prohibiting Future Ransom Payments to Iran Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 5931, to provide for the prohibition on cash payments to the Government of Iran, by a recorded vote of 254 ayes to 163 noes, Roll No. 554.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, the amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-64 shall be considered as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule, in lieu of the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Foreign Affairs now printed in the bill.<P/>Engel amendment (No. 5 printed in H. Rept. 114-781) that sought to require the President to notify Congress of a payment made to any State Sponsor of Terrorism or North Korea pursuant to a settlement or judgment against the United States; requires the President to report on pending claims before the Iran-US Claims Tribunal (by a recorded vote of 176 ayes to 238 noes, Roll No. 553).<P/>Agreed that the Clerk be authorized to make technical and conforming changes to reflect the actions of the House.<P/>H. Res. 879, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5931) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 236 ayes to 178 noes, Roll No. 543, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 236 yeas to 175 nays, Roll No. 542.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Prohibiting Future Ransom Payments to Iran Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 5931, to provide for the prohibition on cash payments to the Government of Iran, by a recorded vote of 254 ayes to 163 noes, Roll No. 554.<P/>Pursuant to the Rule, the amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-64 shall be considered as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five-minute rule, in lieu of the amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Foreign Affairs now printed in the bill.<P/>Engel amendment (No. 5 printed in H. Rept. 114-781) that sought to require the President to notify Congress of a payment made to any State Sponsor of Terrorism or North Korea pursuant to a settlement or judgment against the United States; requires the President to report on pending claims before the Iran-US Claims Tribunal (by a recorded vote of 176 ayes to 238 noes, Roll No. 553).<P/>Agreed that the Clerk be authorized to make technical and conforming changes to reflect the actions of the House.<P/>H. Res. 879, the rule providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5931) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 236 ayes to 178 noes, Roll No. 543, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 236 yeas to 175 nays, Roll No. 542.

titleInfo.title: EMPOWERING EMPLOYEES THROUGH STOCK OWNERSHIP ACT

extension.searchTitle: EMPOWERING EMPLOYEES THROUGH STOCK OWNERSHIP ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 144

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Empowering Employees through Stock Ownership Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed H.R. 5719, to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify the tax treatment of certain equity grants, by a yea-and-nay vote of 287 yeas to 124 nays, Roll No. 544.

titleInfo.title: SOCIAL SECURITY MUST AVERT IDENTITY LOSS (MAIL) ACT OF 2016

extension.searchTitle: SOCIAL SECURITY MUST AVERT IDENTITY LOSS (MAIL) ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 144

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Social Security Must Avert Identity Loss (MAIL) Act of 2016
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures which were debated on Tuesday, September 20th:<P/>H.R. 5320, amended, to restrict the inclusion of social security account numbers on documents sent by mail by the Social Security Administration, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 414 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 545;

titleInfo.title: UNITED STATES APPRECIATION FOR OLYMPIANS AND PARALYMPIANS ACT OF 2016

extension.searchTitle: UNITED STATES APPRECIATION FOR OLYMPIANS AND PARALYMPIANS ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 144

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: United States Appreciation for Olympians and Paralympians Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures which were debated on Tuesday, September 20th:<P/>H.R. 5946, amended, to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exclude from gross income any prizes or awards won in competition in the Olympic Games or the Paralympic Games, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 415 yeas to 1 nay, Roll No. 546;

titleInfo.title: PREVENT TRAFFICKING IN CULTURAL PROPERTY ACT

extension.searchTitle: PREVENT TRAFFICKING IN CULTURAL PROPERTY ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 144

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Prevent Trafficking in Cultural Property Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures which were debated on Tuesday, September 20th:<P/>H.R. 2285, amended, to improve enforcement against trafficking in cultural property and prevent stolen or illicit cultural property from financing terrorist and criminal networks, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 415 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 547;

titleInfo.title: RESTRAINING EXCESSIVE SEIZURE OF PROPERTY THROUGH THE EXPLOITATION OF CIVIL ASSET FORFEITURE TOOLS ACT

extension.searchTitle: RESTRAINING EXCESSIVE SEIZURE OF PROPERTY THROUGH THE EXPLOITATION OF CIVIL ASSET FORFEITURE TOOLS ACT; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 144

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Clyde-Hirsch-Sowers Restraining Excessive Seizure of Property through the Exploitation of Civil Asset Forfeiture Tools Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures which were debated on Tuesday, September 20th:<P/>H.R. 5523, amended, to amend title 31, United States Code, to prohibit the Internal Revenue Service from carrying out seizures relating to a structuring transaction unless the property to be seized derived from an illegal source or the funds were structured for the purpose of concealing the violation of another criminal law or regulation, and to require notice and a post-seizure hearing for such seizures, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 415 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 548;

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
